citation.article-title: Microbulbifer salipaludis sp. nov., a moderate halophile isolated from a Korean salt marsh.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Microbulbifer salipaludis sp. nov.
Microbulbifer salipaludis (sa.li.pa.lu′dis. L. n. sal salt; L. gen. n. paludis of a swamp; N.L. gen. n. salipaludis of a salt marsh).
Gram-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods, 0·3–0·5×1·2–3·0 μm.
In microscopic examinations, numerous vesicles are observed.
Gram-staining reaction is negative.
Colonies are smooth, circular, slightly irregular, flat with erose margins, greyish-yellow in colour and 2·0–4·0 mm in diameter after 3 days cultivation at 37 °C on MA.
Optimal growth temperature is 37 °C.
Growth occurs at 10 and 45 °C, but not at 4 °C or above 46 °C.
Optimal growth pH is 7·0–8·0.
Weak growth occurs at pH 5·0, but not at pH 4·5.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 2–3 % NaCl.
Growth occurs in the presence of 10 % NaCl, but not in the absence of NaCl or in the presence of more than 11 % NaCl.
No growth occurs under anaerobic conditions on MA.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Aesculin, starch, Tween 80 and xylan are hydrolysed.
Agar, casein and tyrosine are weakly hydrolysed.
Chitin, hypoxanthine and xanthine are not hydrolysed.
Acid is produced from d-cellobiose, d-glucose, maltose and l-rhamnose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, myo-inositol, lactose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-melezitose, melibiose, d-raffinose, d-ribose, d-sorbitol, stachyose, sucrose, d-trehalose or d-xylose.

The following enzymes are present when assayed with the API ZYM system: alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.

The following enzymes are absent when assayed with the API ZYM system: lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
The predominant respiratory lipoquinone is ubiquinone-8.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.

The type strain is strain SM-1T (=KCCM 41586T =JCM 11542T), which has a DNA G+C content of 59 mol% (determined by HPLC) and was isolated from a salt marsh around the junction of the Youngsan River and the Yellow Sea in Korea.
